name: wlogle
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, class c0, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3
body: |- wi(wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c0))), w1)
-| wi(wa(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s0)), wceq(cv(s3), cv(s1))), wb(w2, w1))
-| wi(wa(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wceq(cv(s3), cv(s0))), wb(w2, w3))
-| wi(wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c0))), wb(w1, w3))
-| wi(wa(w0, w3a(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c0), wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1)))), w1)

comment: If the predicate ` ch ( x , y ) ` is symmetric under interchange of ` x , y ` , then "without loss of generality" we can assume that ` x <_ y ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-Aug-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 11-Sep-2014.)
